section.title: Overview
section.para: The following list of commands are originally from GMAT, but are designed to be called from MATLAB__�__ to be run in GMAT. Under the Interfaces folder in the resource tree, the MATLAB__�__ Server must be started so MATLAB__�__ can call GMAT commands and run them in GMAT. After a command is entered into MATLAB__�__, run the and then notice that GMAT automatically executes the command.

section.title: GMAT Commands with Similar Syntax
section.para: The commands below all have similar MATLAB__�__ syntax and can be seen by opening up any one of the files. The script files send the functions from MATLAB__�__ to GMAT and into their respective places in the mission sequence. The commands are then built and run in the sequence as they would normally have been if originally created and used in GMAT.

section.title: MATLAB� Commands with Similar Syntax
section.para: The purpose of the following files is to identify and convert any line of structured GMAT code into a readable string for MATLAB__�__. Once a string or array of strings is converted, GMAT is called and the strings are sent back into a GMAT script to be built and then run. An example of a multilevel string, depending on the object and parameter being defined, is when an spacecraft is called with X, Y, and Z coordinates.
